alert.note: Alert for Duplin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 6:51PM EST until December 17 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following county, Duplin. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM EST, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wallace, Warsaw, Mount Olive, Rose Hill, Bowdens, Beautancus, Kenansville, Faison, Magnolia, Calypso and Teachey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
